content.original: The Aurigan Directorate replaced the Aurigan Coalition when Santiago Espinosa, adviser to the High Lady Kamea Arano, betrayed her and led a coup against her government. In the years since that coup, Director Espinosa has solidified his hold on the systems of the Directorate, binding the Founding Families to his cause with a mixture of promises and threats. His rule is oppressive and militaristic, with individual liberties sacrificed to the cause of security and stability.

content.original: The unsettled and abandoned systems of the Rimward Frontier are a haven for piratesboth in-system predators and renegade JumpShip captains who transport pirate DropShips from one system to another, taking a cut of any illicit profits.

content.original: The Arano Restoration is the remnant of the former Aurigan Coalition, driven from power by the treachery of Santiago Espinosa. Those still loyal to the Arano family fled into the Rimward Frontier, the expanse of unsettled systems adjoining the Magistracy of Canopus. Many noble houses of the Aurigan Directorate harbor sympathies for the Restoration and its cause: returning the Arano monarchy to power.

content.original: ComStar, the institution and religion, grew out of the Star League Department of Communications, as reenvisioned by Jerome Blake, Minister of Communications. ComStar is transnational, beholden to none of the Successor States, and its priesthood exclusively controls access to the only means of faster-than-light communications, the HyperPulse Generators. ComStar facilities and personnel are sacrosanct, a status enforced aggressively by the institution; offending stateseven entire Successor Statescan find themselves cut off from the rest of the Inner Sphere, unable to communicate or trade. The current head of ComStar is Primus Julian Tiepolo.

content.original: The Federated Suns is one of the five Successor States of the Star League, located rimward and spinward of Terra. Ruled by House Davion, the Federation is the most powerful of the five, and the people of the Federation pride themselves on their self-proclaimed role as defenders of justice and liberty. The Federation is quite capable of ruthless, decisive action, though, and its idealism readily gives way to pragmatism when called for. The current ruler of the Federation, Prince Hanse Davion, is an experienced and unconventional military commander. The Federation's alliance with the Lyran Commonwealth effectively ended the Third Succession War.

content.original: The Draconis Combine is one of the five Successor States of the Star League, located coreward and spinward of Terra. Ruled by House Kurita, the Combine has always been aggressively expansionistthe head of the Combine was the first of the Council Lords to declare himself the new ruler of the collapsing Star League. Regularly in conflicts along its borders with all its neighbors, the Combine is a highly structured, militaristic society, with rulership in the hands of the Coordinator, the commander-in-chief of the Draconis military. The Combine's culture is heavily influenced by the Japanese roots of the ruling familydespite the minority status of those with Japanese ancestryas this cultural heritage is imposed from above by the predominantly Japanese ruling class. The current leader of the Combine is Coordinator Takashi Kurita.

content.original: The Capellan Confederation is one of the five Successor States of the Star League, located rimward of Terra. Ruled by House Liao, the Confederation is the smallest and newest of the Successor States and often the loser in conflicts against the other powers of the Inner Sphere. It is an authoritarian police state, with philosophical origins in a text known as the Korvin Doctrine, which argues for total subservience of the individual to the state. Citizens of the Confederation must earn their position and the benefits of citizenship through service to their community. The current ruler of the Confederation is Chancellor Maximilian Liao, a shrewd planner and master manipulator.

content.original: This world is independently ruled by a planetary government, unaffiliated with any of the interstellar states of the Inner Sphere or the Periphery.

content.original: Lady Centrella represents The Magistracy of Canopus, a large Periphery state, located rimwards and anti-spinwards of Terra, just beyond the Free Worlds League. Founded explicitly as a matriarchy, the Magistracy is ruled by a Magestrix, a position open only to women, and usually held by a member of the founding Centrella family. Independent since the fall of the Star League, the Magistracy has remained mostly untouched by the Succession Wars, except by the overall collapse of trade and travel. The Magistracy is famed for its social and cultural freedom, with no consensual behavior forbidden by law or custom. The current ruler of the Magistracy is the Magestrix Kyalla Centrella, who harbors a deep grudge against the Inner Sphere, and the Free Worlds League in particular.

content.original: The Free Worlds League is one of the five Successor States of the Star League, located rimward and anti-spinward of Terra. Ruled by House Marik, the League was, with the Capellan Confederation, one of the original signatories of the treaties that would eventually form the Star League. After the fall of the Star League, the Free Worlds League granted broad control over its economy and government to the commander of its military, the Captain-General. The League is known for being a powerful mercantile state, but the Succession Wars have nearly destroyed its economy. The current ruler of the League is Captain-General Janos Marik.

content.original: The Star League Defense Force (SLDF) was the largest military force in human history, with over 100 million soldiers serving in 486 divisions at its peak. The SLDF suffered horrific losses opposing Stefan Amaris in the Amaris Civil War.

content.original: This world has been abandoned, and only a remnant population exists here, with no real government.
content.prevOriginal: This world has been abandoned, and only a remnant population exists here, with no real government.

content.original: The Lyran Commonwealth is one of the five Successor States of the Star League, located coreward and anti-spinward of Terra. Ruled by House Steiner, the Commonwealth is the wealthiest of the five, with an entrenched and powerful noble class. The focus on pedigree and prestige among the nobility has often resulted in less-than-brilliant officers being elevated to high command, to the detriment of the Commonwealth's military strength. Much of the Commonwealth's success comes from the vast resources located within its borders. The current ruler of the Commonwealth is Archon Katrina Steiner, notable for her peace proposal that, in allying the Commonwealth with the Federated Suns, effectively ended the Third Succession War.

content.original: The Taurian Concordat is one of the largest Periphery states, located rimward of Terra, beyond the Federated Suns. Founded and ruled by House Calderon, the Concordat prides itself on its independence, freedom, and stability. The Concordat is wealthy, well educated, and well armed for a Periphery state. The Taurians defend their independence fiercely against Inner Sphere aggression, particularly by the Federated Suns; they perceive House Davion's reputation as a protector of liberties as unwarranted and even hypocritical, and they have a long history of conflict with the much larger Successor State. The current ruler of the Concordat is Protector Thomas Calderon.

content.original: The Duchy of Andurien was a member province of House Marik's Free Worlds League throughout most of its history before becoming an independent nation in 3079. The water-rich Andurien worlds were disputed between the Free Worlds League and House Liao's Capellan Confederation from early in the Age of War until the First Succession War when the region was finally secured by the League.

content.original: The Amaris Empire was the realization of Stefan's great ambitions. Viewing all the Inner Sphere, and specifically the Star League, as oppressor states who were crushing the Periphery states, Stefan planned a military coup to overthrow the League leadership and take the power. The death of First Lord Simon Cameron in 2751 was his opportunity. The First Lord's death, apparently an accident, later was discovered to be a murder, but it remains unknown if it was the work of Stefan or not. In any case, Stefan approached Richard Cameron, the young successor of Simon, winning his trust, murdering him, all his family and anyone loyal to the Camerons. The Amaris Coup was a great initial success, conquering all worlds of the Terran Hegemony.

content.original: The Axumite Providence is a primitive Islamic state in the Deep Periphery. The nearest system is located 1,000 light years anti-spinward of Terra, located at the trailing edge of Orion's Bow.  The Axumites have limited 20th century technology, and little else.

content.original: The Calderon Protectorate is a small Periphery state located spinward of the Taurian Concordat. The Protectorate began as a collection of small settlements newly-colonized by the Taurian Concordat, an effort which started with the Far Lookers movement and was backed by Concordat financial interests

content.original: Nueva Castile isn't actually a faction per se, but more a typical outer periphery area in flux.  It is lacking in HPG stations, and so far out of touch with the rest of the inner sphere that hardly anyone knows what's really going on there.

content.original: The Chainelane Isles is not a unified realm, but rather a collection of waring planet-states and minor principalities fighting with mostly pre-mech tech.

content.original: The Circinus Federation are effectively a highly organized pirate group that operates under the guise of being the legitimate armed forces of a democratically elected government.

content.original: Named for the esprit-de-corps that bound the original 800 Clan warriors, Clan Blood Spirit ironically became the most isolationist and bitter of the Clans. They believed that the other Clans had abandoned the way set down by Nicholas Kerensky.

content.content: Named for the esprit-de-corps that bound the original 800 Clan warriors, Clan Blood Spirit ironically became the most isolationist and bitter of the Clans. They believed that the other Clans had abandoned the way set down by Nicholas Kerensky.

content.original: Clan Burrock is one of the original 20 Clans founded by Nicholas Kerensky, and is regarded as one of the more enlightened of the Crusader Clans as far as their treatment of commoners and freeborn.
content.prevOriginal: Clan Burrock is one of the original 20 Clans founded by Nicholas Kerensky, and is regarded as one of the more enlightened of the Crusader Clans as far as their treatment of commoners and freeborn.
content.content: Clan Burrock is one of the original 20 Clans founded by Nicholas Kerensky, and is regarded as one of the more enlightened of the Crusader Clans as far as their treatment of commoners and freeborn.

content.original: The only Clan defined by its incorporation of organized religions, Clan Cloud Cobra's warrior-priests are organized into Cloisters and dedicated themselves to an overarching concept known as The Way.  Clan Cloud Cobra are one of the Warden Clans, who seek to preserve the inner sphere.
content.prevOriginal: The only Clan defined by its incorporation of organized religions, Clan Cloud Cobra's warrior-priests are organized into Cloisters and dedicated themselves to an overarching concept known as The Way.  Clan Cloud Cobra are one of the Warden Clans, who seek to preserve the inner sphere.
content.content: The only Clan defined by its incorporation of organized religions, Clan Cloud Cobra's warrior-priests are organized into Cloisters and dedicated themselves to an overarching concept known as The Way. Clan Cloud Cobra are one of the Warden Clans, who seek to preserve the inner sphere.

content.original: The Coyote Clan was responsible for the invention of the OmniMech and is one of the strongest of the Warden Clans. The Coyotes were also known for their mystical beliefs, based on native American religious practices.
content.prevOriginal: The Coyote Clan was responsible for the invention of the OmniMech and is one of the strongest of the Warden Clans. The Coyotes were also known for their mystical beliefs, based on native American religious practices.
content.content: The Coyote Clan was responsible for the invention of the OmniMech and is one of the strongest of the Warden Clans. The Coyotes were also known for their mystical beliefs, based on native American religious practices.

content.original: Originally known as Clan Sea Fox, and often referred to as the Merchant Clan, the Diamond Sharks were among the most powerful and progressive of the Warden Clans.
content.prevOriginal: Originally known as Clan Sea Fox, and often referred to as the Merchant Clan, the Diamond Sharks were among the most powerful and progressive of the Warden Clans.
content.content: Originally known as Clan Sea Fox, and often referred to as the Merchant Clan, the Diamond Sharks were among the most powerful and progressive of the Warden Clans.

content.original: Probably the most fractious of the Clans, the Fire Mandrill are as likely to fight each other as they are an enemy.
content.prevOriginal: Probably the most fractious of the Clans, the Fire Mandrill are as likely to fight each other as they are an enemy.
content.content: Probably the most fractious of the Clans, the Fire Mandrill are as likely to fight each other as they are an enemy.

content.original: Among the most powerful of the Clans, the Ghost Bears were defined by their conservative 'wait and see nature' and their deep familial relationship with each other.
content.prevOriginal: Among the most powerful of the Clans, the Ghost Bears were defined by their conservative 'wait and see nature' and their deep familial relationship with each other.
content.content: Among the most powerful of the Clans, the Ghost Bears were defined by their conservative 'wait and see nature' and their deep familial relationship with each other.

content.original: The Goliath Scorpion Clan was obsessed with recovering any and all lost artifacts of the fallen Star League, sending Seekers fueled by necrosa visions far and wide to recover them.
content.prevOriginal: The Goliath Scorpion Clan was obsessed with recovering any and all lost artifacts of the fallen Star League, sending Seekers fueled by necrosa visions far and wide to recover them.
content.content: The Goliath Scorpion Clan was obsessed with recovering any and all lost artifacts of the fallen Star League, sending Seekers fueled by necrosa visions far and wide to recover them.

content.original: Known for their prominent use of combat vehicles in front-line forces, the Hell's Horses lived by the motto that man came before machine and all members were valued as being part of a greater whole, including freebirths.
content.prevOriginal: Known for their prominent use of combat vehicles in front-line forces, the Hell's Horses lived by the motto that man came before machine and all members were valued as being part of a greater whole, including freebirths.
content.content: Known for their prominent use of combat vehicles in front-line forces, the Hell's Horses lived by the motto that man came before machine and all members were valued as being part of a greater whole, including freebirths.

content.original: A fierce, quick-handed Clan bordering on reckless, the Ice Hellion Clan often grasped for prizes beyond their reach and could be their own worst enemy. Ice Hellion warriors prized the ability to strike first above other considerations.
content.prevOriginal: A fierce, quick-handed Clan bordering on reckless, the Ice Hellion Clan often grasped for prizes beyond their reach and could be their own worst enemy. Ice Hellion warriors prized the ability to strike first above other considerations.
content.content: A fierce, quick-handed Clan bordering on reckless, the Ice Hellion Clan often grasped for prizes beyond their reach and could be their own worst enemy. Ice Hellion warriors prized the ability to strike first above other considerations.

content.original: Staunch traditionalists and aggressive fighters, the Jade Falcons were central in the creation of the Crusader philosophy. They live by the mantra 'might makes right'
content.prevOriginal: Staunch traditionalists and aggressive fighters, the Jade Falcons were central in the creation of the Crusader philosophy. They live by the mantra 'might makes right'
content.content: Staunch traditionalists and aggressive fighters, the Jade Falcons were central in the creation of the Crusader philosophy. They live by the mantra 'might makes right'

content.original: A Clan marked by their own unique brand of mysticism, the Nova Cats are guided by visions and portents, and even its Khans first consulted with the Oathmaster before undertaking any action which could affect the Clan.
content.prevOriginal: A Clan marked by their own unique brand of mysticism, the Nova Cats are guided by visions and portents, and even its Khans first consulted with the Oathmaster before undertaking any action which could affect the Clan.
content.content: A Clan marked by their own unique brand of mysticism, the Nova Cats are guided by visions and portents, and even its Khans first consulted with the Oathmaster before undertaking any action which could affect the Clan.

content.original: The Clans were originally descended from the self-exiled remnants of the Star League Defense Force (SLDF), who had departed the Inner Sphere after Stefan Amaris brought about the downfall of the Star League. General Aleksandr Kerensky led his forces to a hidden destination far from the Great Houses.  Aleksandr's son Nicholas Kerensky took command of the exiles, reorganizing them into twenty Clans of warriors leading and protecting their attendant civilian castes
content.prevOriginal: The Clans were originally descended from the self-exiled remnants of the Star League Defense Force (SLDF), who had departed the Inner Sphere after Stefan Amaris brought about the downfall of the Star League. General Aleksandr Kerensky led his forces to a hidden destination far from the Great Houses.  Aleksandr's son Nicholas Kerensky took command of the exiles, reorganizing them into twenty Clans of warriors leading and protecting their attendant civilian castes

Aleksandr's son Nicholas Kerensky took command of the exiles, reorganizing them into twenty Clans of warriors leading and protecting their attendant civilian castes

content.original: Clan Smoke Jaguar was among the most aggressive and warlike of the Clans, even at the expense of more peaceful endeavors, and were early supporters of the Crusader philosophy.  They are noted for repressing anyone but their own Warrior Caste.
content.prevOriginal: Clan Smoke Jaguar was among the most aggressive and warlike of the Clans, even at the expense of more peaceful endeavors, and were early supporters of the Crusader philosophy.  They are noted for repressing anyone but their own Warrior Caste.
content.content: Clan Smoke Jaguar was among the most aggressive and warlike of the Clans, even at the expense of more peaceful endeavors, and were early supporters of the Crusader philosophy. They are noted for repressing anyone but their own Warrior Caste.

content.original: Masters of compromise and manipulation, Clan Snow Raven were opportunists of the highest order, possessing an almost un-Clanlike sense of self-preservation and a willingness to sell their services to the highest bidder.
content.prevOriginal: Masters of compromise and manipulation, Clan Snow Raven were opportunists of the highest order, possessing an almost un-Clanlike sense of self-preservation and a willingness to sell their services to the highest bidder.
content.content: Masters of compromise and manipulation, Clan Snow Raven were opportunists of the highest order, possessing an almost un-Clanlike sense of self-preservation and a willingness to sell their services to the highest bidder.

content.original: A conservative Clan, the Star Adders are known for their pragmatism and their strategic (rather than tactical) view towards battle, as well as treating freeborn that proved themselves as equals.
content.prevOriginal: A conservative Clan, the Star Adders are known for their pragmatism and their strategic (rather than tactical) view towards battle, as well as treating freeborn that proved themselves as equals.
content.content: A conservative Clan, the Star Adders are known for their pragmatism and their strategic (rather than tactical) view towards battle, as well as treating freeborn that proved themselves as equals.

content.original: The Steel Vipers had the toughest training regime of any Clan save the Blood Spirits, graduating fewer but more elite warriors, and were more discriminating against freebirths than other Clans.
content.prevOriginal: The Steel Vipers had the toughest training regime of any Clan save the Blood Spirits, graduating fewer but more elite warriors, and were more discriminating against freebirths than other Clans.
content.content: The Steel Vipers had the toughest training regime of any Clan save the Blood Spirits, graduating fewer but more elite warriors, and were more discriminating against freebirths than other Clans.

content.original: Named from the feline inhabiting the northern mountains of Tokasha, Clan Stone Lion was created from the remaining Homeworld members of Clan Hell's Horses after the Abjuration of their Inner Sphere portion in 3075
content.prevOriginal: Named from the feline inhabiting the northern mountains of Tokasha, Clan Stone Lion was created from the remaining Homeworld members of Clan Hell's Horses after the Abjuration of their Inner Sphere portion in 3075
content.content: Named from the feline inhabiting the northern mountains of Tokasha, Clan Stone Lion was created from the remaining Homeworld members of Clan Hell's Horses after the Abjuration of their Inner Sphere portion in 3075

content.original: The chosen Clan of Nicholas Kerensky, the Wolves have dominated Clan society since their inception. Less formal and more flexible than others, Clan Wolf emulated its namesake by blending caution with decisiveness.
content.prevOriginal: The chosen Clan of Nicholas Kerensky, the Wolves have dominated Clan society since their inception. Less formal and more flexible than others, Clan Wolf emulated its namesake by blending caution with decisiveness.
content.content: The chosen Clan of Nicholas Kerensky, the Wolves have dominated Clan society since their inception. Less formal and more flexible than others, Clan Wolf emulated its namesake by blending caution with decisiveness.

content.original: Clan Wolf-in-Exile is a splinter faction of the original Clan Wolf, one of the twenty Clans created by Nicholas Kerensky. Born from the destruction of the original Clan Wolf in the Refusal War, the Wolves-in-Exile continued to uphold the Warden traditions of their forebears under the leadership of Khan Phelan Kell by siding with the Inner Sphere
content.prevOriginal: Clan Wolf-in-Exile is a splinter faction of the original Clan Wolf, one of the twenty Clans created by Nicholas Kerensky. content.original: The Dark Caste is largely a mystery. Equipped with ancient Clan mechs from their Golden Century as well as old mothballed SLDF mechs, the Dark Caste appear to be little more than Clan renegades and bandits, raiding Deep Periphery states with impunity and marauding at will. They have no leadership or goals, they exist only to survive at any cost.

content.original: Little is known about the New Delphi Compact, apart from the capital being New Delphi.  This area will probably be quickly absorbed into a nearby faction anyway, so it's almost certainly not worth your trouble.
content.prevOriginal: Little is known about the New Delphi Compact, apart from the capital being New Delphi.  This area will probably be quickly absorbed into a nearby faction anyway, so it's almost certainly not worth your trouble.

content.original: The Elysian worlds are all planets maintained in their pristine wilderness state. The people supported themselves mainly as hunters and gatherers, and almost universally follow the One Star faith.
content.prevOriginal: The Elysian worlds are all planets maintained in their pristine wilderness state. The people supported themselves mainly as hunters and gatherers, and almost universally follow the One Star faith.
content.content: The Elysian worlds are all planets maintained in their pristine wilderness state. The people supported themselves mainly as hunters and gatherers, and almost universally follow the One Star faith.

content.original: The Escorpion Imperio was formed in 3080 after Clan Goliath Scorpion was Abjured by the Grand Council. They left Clan Space and conquered the Deep Periphery states known as Nueva Castile and the Umayyad Caliphate
content.prevOriginal: The Escorpion Imperio was formed in 3080 after Clan Goliath Scorpion was Abjured by the Grand Council. They left Clan Space and conquered the Deep Periphery states known as Nueva Castile and the Umayyad Caliphate

content.original: The Filtvelt Coalition is a Periphery realm that formed on February 20, 3072 from worlds that seceded from the Federated Suns
content.prevOriginal: The Filtvelt Coalition is a Periphery realm that formed on February 20, 3072 from worlds that seceded from the Federated Suns
content.content: The Filtvelt Coalition is a Periphery realm that formed on February 20, 3072 from worlds that seceded from the Federated Suns

content.original: The Fronc Reaches is a small Periphery state located in the Capellan Marches rimward of the Capellan Confederation, spinward of the Magistracy of Canopus, and anti-spinward of the Taurian Concordat. The Fronc Reaches formed from worlds jointly colonized by the Magistracy of Canopus and the Taurian Concordat, formerly known as the New Colony Region.
content.prevOriginal: The Fronc Reaches is a small Periphery state located in the Capellan Marches rimward of the Capellan Confederation, spinward of the Magistracy of Canopus, and anti-spinward of the Taurian Concordat. content.original: An amalgamation of the Free Rasalhague Republic and Clan Ghost Bear, the Rasalhague Dominion is a blend of the political, military and cultural styles of Inner Sphere and Clan societies. Founded in 3060 as the Ghost Bear Dominion the new state was isolationist by inclination, only waging war against the Draconis Combine and Word of Blake due to external factors

content.original: The so-called Green Ghosts are an enigmatic and highly unusual warband. They began raiding the Lyran (coreward and anti-spinward) periphery border, i.e. the general area of the former Rim Worlds Republic, in 3060 and continued their operations at least through 3089.

content.original: The Hanseatic League is a mercantile faction located in the Deep Periphery.  Mercenaries are welcome, and the overall technological level of their defence forces is equal to any faction in the Inner Sphere.
content.prevOriginal: The Hanseatic League is a mercantile faction located in the Deep Periphery.  Mercenaries are welcome, and the overall technological level of their defence forces is equal to any faction in the Inner Sphere.

content.original: The Illyrian Palatinate was founded in the mid 24th century by groups of Scandinavian colonists, however it currently faces pressure from both the Circinus Federation and the Marian Hegemony.
content.prevOriginal: The Illyrian Palatinate was founded in the mid 24th century by groups of Scandinavian colonists, however it currently faces pressure from both the Circinus Federation and the Marian Hegemony.
content.content: The Illyrian Palatinate was founded in the mid 24th century by groups of Scandinavian colonists, however it currently faces pressure from both the Circinus Federation and the Marian Hegemony.

content.original: The unsettled and abandoned systems of the Rimward Frontier are a haven for piratesboth in-system predators and renegade JumpShip captains who transport pirate DropShips from one system to another, taking a cut of any illicit profits.
content.prevOriginal: The unsettled and abandoned systems of the Rimward Frontier are a haven for piratesboth in-system predators and renegade JumpShip captains who transport pirate DropShips from one system to another, taking a cut of any illicit profits.
content.content: The unsettled and abandoned systems of the Rimward Frontier are a haven for piratesboth in-system predators and renegade JumpShip captains who transport pirate DropShips from one system to another, taking a cut of any illicit profits.

content.original: The St. Ives Compact was a minor Inner Sphere nation that existed from 3029 to 3063.
content.prevOriginal: The St. Ives Compact was a minor Inner Sphere nation that existed from 3029 to 3063.
content.content: The St. Ives Compact was a minor Inner Sphere nation that existed from 3029 to 3063.

content.original: The JarnFolk (literally 'Iron People') are a society of deep Periphery denizens residing approximately 250 light years spinward of Columbus.  They live a primarily agrarian lifestyle.
content.prevOriginal: The JarnFolk (literally 'Iron People') are a society of deep Periphery denizens residing approximately 250 light years spinward of Columbus.  They live a primarily agrarian lifestyle.
content.content: The JarnFolk (literally 'Iron People') are a society of deep Periphery denizens residing approximately 250 light years spinward of Columbus. They live a primarily agrarian lifestyle.

content.original: The Lothian League was a small Periphery realm composed by six ice-and-snow planets located beyond the outer reaches of the Free Worlds League near the Marian Hegemony.
content.prevOriginal: The Lothian League was a small Periphery realm composed by six ice-and-snow planets located beyond the outer reaches of the Free Worlds League near the Marian Hegemony.
content.content: The Lothian League was a small Periphery realm composed by six ice-and-snow planets located beyond the outer reaches of the Free Worlds League near the Marian Hegemony.

content.original: The Marian Hegemony is an expansionist periphery faction who's government and military are based on the ancient Terran Roman Empire.
content.prevOriginal: The Marian Hegemony is an expansionist periphery faction who's government and military are based on the ancient Terran Roman Empire.
content.content: The Marian Hegemony is an expansionist periphery faction who's government and military are based on the ancient Terran Roman Empire.

content.original: The Marik-Stewart Commonwealth was one of the successor states to the late Free Worlds League. The nation constitutes the core of what was once the League, including the capital of Atreus.
content.prevOriginal: The Marik-Stewart Commonwealth was one of the successor states to the late Free Worlds League. The nation constitutes the core of what was once the League, including the capital of Atreus.
content.content: The Marik-Stewart Commonwealth was one of the successor states to the late Free Worlds League. The nation constitutes the core of what was once the League, including the capital of Atreus.

content.original: The Oberon Confederation is quite simply a bandit state, veiled in a thin veneer of legitimacy.  Piracy and slavery is still rampant, although Hendrick Grimm III has made steps to push such things out of the public eye.
content.prevOriginal: The Oberon Confederation is quite simply a bandit state, veiled in a thin veneer of legitimacy.  Piracy and slavery is still rampant, although Hendrick Grimm III has made steps to push such things out of the public eye.
content.content: The Oberon Confederation is quite simply a bandit state, veiled in a thin veneer of legitimacy. Piracy and slavery is still rampant, although Hendrick Grimm III has made steps to push such things out of the public eye.

content.original: The Oriente Protectorate was founded in 3086, after the dissolution of the Free Worlds League. Descended from one of the original founding states of the League, the Oriente Protectorate is a fusion of the Grand Duchy of Oriente, the Protectorate, and the Duchy of Orloff. Oriente is theoretically a representative government, but it operates under military rule, much like the Free Worlds League after the fall of the Star League.

content.original: Since the beginning of the 31st century, the situation in the Outworlds Alliance has become particularly grim. With the general loss of technology, Alliance worlds have suffered from declining population and literacy levels.
content.prevOriginal: Since the beginning of the 31st century, the situation in the Outworlds Alliance has become particularly grim. With the general loss of technology, Alliance worlds have suffered from declining population and literacy levels.

content.original: The Free Rasalhague Republic was a nation born in the wake of the Fourth Succession War, which enjoyed less than two decades of independence before finding themselves directly in the path of the Clan invasion.
content.prevOriginal: The Free Rasalhague Republic was a nation born in the wake of the Fourth Succession War, which enjoyed less than two decades of independence before finding themselves directly in the path of the Clan invasion.
content.content: The Free Rasalhague Republic was a nation born in the wake of the Fourth Succession War, which enjoyed less than two decades of independence before finding themselves directly in the path of the Clan invasion.

content.original: After Clan Snow Raven lost their holdings and was abjured from Clan Space during the Wars of Reaving, they would seek refuge with their allies in the Outworlds Alliance. Seeing the similarities and benefits between both factions, they would bore a fruitful relationship that would result in the merging of the Raven Alliance after the Jihad ended.
content.prevOriginal: After Clan Snow Raven lost their holdings and was abjured from Clan Space during the Wars of Reaving, they would seek refuge with their allies in the Outworlds Alliance. Seeing the similarities and benefits between both factions, they would bore a fruitful relationship that would result in the merging of the Raven Alliance after the Jihad ended.

content.original: The Principality of Regulus is one of the founding nations of the Free Worlds League. Following the dissolution of that confederation, the Regulan Fiefs was founded as the union of the Principality of Regulus, Regulan Free States, and the Principality of Gibson. It is led by the Cameron-Jones family from the city of Tunis on Regulus.

content.original: The Republic of the Sphere is the buffer state created in the wake of the Word of Blake Jihad. Keeping the peace in the heart of the Inner Sphere is no small task.
content.prevOriginal: The Republic of the Sphere is the buffer state created in the wake of the Word of Blake Jihad. Keeping the peace in the heart of the Inner Sphere is no small task.
content.content: The Republic of the Sphere is the buffer state created in the wake of the Word of Blake Jihad. Keeping the peace in the heart of the Inner Sphere is no small task.

content.original: The Rim Collection is a minor nationstate founded by six planets that remembered the old Rim Worlds Republic, pre-Amaris, and wanted to recreate that dream. They are small, democratic, and pretty much harmless. Their military is composed of the mercenary group Able's Aces who have become national heroes for the Collection.

content.original: During the Jihad, the Rim Commonality declared independence from the League on the 13th of April 3075 The Rim Commonality cited the historic Camlann versus Free Worlds ruling as precedent, barring entry to all high-ranking Free Worlds League representatives and breaking away from the League.
content.prevOriginal: During the Jihad, the Rim Commonality declared independence from the League on the 13th of April 3075 The Rim Commonality cited the historic Camlann versus Free Worlds ruling as precedent, barring entry to all high-ranking Free Worlds League representatives and breaking away from the League.

content.original: The Rim Worlds Republic, 2250-2769, was born of Hector Worthington Rowe and his five-hundred-strong Theban Legion at the end of their own Second Exodus. Journeying for six years through the Dark Nebula, the men who would create the Republic were anti-Alliance veterans on the run aboard blackmailed JumpShips, plunder from slain garrisons, and a limited number of provisions and women they'd taken as slaves. Simply put - pirates.

Simply put - pirates.
content.content: The Rim Worlds Republic, 2250-2769, was born of Hector Worthington Rowe and his five-hundred-strong Theban Legion at the end of their own Second Exodus. Journeying for six years through the Dark Nebula, the men who would create the Republic were anti-Alliance veterans on the run aboard blackmailed JumpShips, plunder from slain garrisons, and a limited number of provisions and women they'd taken as slaves. Simply put - pirates.

content.original: The Star League Defense Force (SLDF) was the principal military force defending the Star League, a conglomeration of star systems within roughly 500 light years of Terra. At its height the SLDF was the largest military force known to man, composed of over 100 million soldiers organized into 486 divisions. The Star League Defense Force left the Inner Sphere after fighting the Amaris Civil War, when Stefan Amaris overthrew the ruling First Lord of the Star League, Richard Cameron. After a long series of bloody battles throughout the Star League, Commanding General Aleksandr Kerensky ended the coup with the liberation of Terra and the execution of Amaris. However when no new First Lord could be agreed upon by the Great Houses the Star League was dissolved. Kerensky then led the surviving 113 divisions out beyond the Inner Sphere in Operation EXODUS, hoping to save the essence of the League from the internecine violence that was to come. The SLDF would return 300 years later as the Clans, a technologically superior military that invaded the Inner Sphere in 3049.

content.original: The Duchy of Tamarind was originally a province of the Free Worlds League. It seceded from the League during the Word of Blake Jihad, and would later combine with the Abbey District to form the Duchy of Tamarind-Abbey, an independent state.

content.original: The Terran Hegemony was an interstellar state located at the center of the Inner Sphere. Established after a military coup led by James McKenna overthrew the dictatorial and decaying Terran Alliance, the Hegemony quickly rose to dominating positions in the realms of technology, military innovation, and diplomacy, and remained the most influential of all interstellar powers for the rest of its existence. The Hegemony's early expansionist period contributed to the formation of the Great Houses, its era of aggressive diplomacy eventually led to the creation of the Star League, and its destruction in the Amaris Civil War led to the Succession Wars.

content.original: The union of two breakaway factions from the Oberon Confederation, namely Butte Hold and Morgraine's Valkyrate in 3028 created the Greater Valkyrate, a Pirate Kingdom that kept the Oberon Confederation in check as their strong antagonist. It was notable for emphasizing the dominance of women over men.

content.original: You turn to Darius, Ok, whos up for a good prank? Darius, get a team over there in our Leopard and lets see whats behind Door Number One. Darius keys in some commands, The Leopard is dispatching in 10 minutes to dock with the TRICK door, Commander. The crew watch the live feed on the screen as the away team docks with the derelict ship, then manually unlocks and opens the cargo door. As the door slides back the beam lights show rack upon rack of cargo containers. You whistle, Sweet Kerensky, what have we just stumbled upon here? Darius breaks the reverie, Dont forget Commander, that door was labeled TRICK. You look at Darius, Noted. Have the team proceed with caution, and start loading those crates onto the Leopard. As the team are locking down the third crate, an alarm sounds and Darius yells out, Commander, the ship has activated its self destruct sequence! We have 15 minutes before critical mass! Get them out if there and back to the Argo now, you shout. As the Leopard leaps away from the derelict, its hull shudders and a few seconds later explodes into a ball of fire and molten metal. You turn to the bridge crew, Well, that could have gone better. Lets go see what we were tricked into bringing aboard the Argo.

content.original:
Darius looks defeated. "Understood, Commander. I'll tell my friend that we can't go looking for them."

Yang gives you a sidelong glance as your XO turns to go. "Oh I think we're going to get them out, the commander just doesn't want to take your friend's money."

"And knowledge, Yang," Farah adds, her eyes glittering with excitement. "Saving lives is far more important than a few C-Bills."

content.original:
You nod at Yang. "I agree, equipping a 'Mech will make for a far less enticing target for ROM agents from ComStar."

Later, Farah calls you into Engineering. You find her standing in front of a terminal, a huge smile on her face. "I have managed to penetrate the fortress around Necromosyou know, this is some dangerous territory, but I've done it! Seems Fortresses are generating HPG pulses that throw off navigation computers. The trick is to manually calculate the Jump."

You nod. "Good work, Farah. We will get Darius' men back, thanks to you."

content.original:
You nod at Sumire. "Okay, Meyer your idea sounds promising. Follow up on it. For the time being, this is your top priority."

Later, she calls you to the bridge. You find her standing by the viewscreen, a weary half-smile on her face. "We got it. Commander, we can slip right in nowship and all. Seems ComStar has nav computers automatically failing jumps to Necromos, it's kind of a Fortress system. I've got Necromos back on the star map. We can get going whenever you want. "

You nod. "Good work, Sumire. Our rescue plan is back on, thanks to you."

She looks stern. "Don't remind me."

content.original:
Darius provides an update. "I got a little creative with the shifts."

He hesitates for a moment. "That said, both our repair and medical facilities will be operating on skeleton crews. We're ready for another surprise attack or inside job. Commander, we can't keep this up forever. We need to finish this fight before it finishes us."

Darius nods, and makes the order.

"I'll brief the medical staff, it's not their job but we need to survive. Injuries are going to heal slowly, but we'll be alive to treat our wounds. We can't keep getting hit like this Commander, we need to end this fight ASAP."

Darius provides an update. "I told everyone what you told me, the best way to prevent more attacks is focusing to keep our 'Mechs and MechWarriors as ready to go."

He looks down. "We can't keep this up forever Commander, the MechWarriors are already starting to talk about abandoning this endeavor. We need to finish this fight before we are attacked again."

content.original:
You assign Darius to train up Yang and the MechTechs. At the end of the first session, Yang approaches you. 

"Boss, my crew are really taking to this tactical stuff. I'm going to ask Darius to come back for the rest of the week. It shouldn't impact our schedule too much. The crew already looks like they'll be sleeping easier tonight, this is what I needed."

content.original:
Farah brings you modified blueprints. "You know, if we just opened this area here and used it to store our armor scraps, it would place 'Mech armor against the bulkhead. In the bays, we can replace this panel with a hidden door to make a safe room."

After inspecting the changes, Yang approaches you. "Thanks Boss, now there's tons more armor between us and the outside. My crew will sleep better tonight and so will I."

Farah brings you modified blueprints. "You know, if we just opened this area here and used it to store our armor scraps, it would place 'Mech armor against the bulkhead. In the bays, we can replace this panel with a hidden door to make a safe room."

After inspecting the changes, Yang approaches you. "Thanks Boss, now there's tons more armor between us and the outside. My crew will sleep better tonight and so will I."

content.original:
You order Yang and his crew more time off with exclusive time slots to hit the Gym, relax in the low-G pool and blow off some steam in the 'Mech pods set to "God Mode."

You run in to Yang coming out of the Gym. "Hey Boss, I just got to say this has helped relieve the stress on my crew. Now that I know they'll be alright, I'm handling each day a little better than the last. I appreciate the help."

content.original: You place a tick next to [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]'s name on the datapad and scribble your signature. Handing the pad to Darius as you stand up, "Ok, lets get [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] to the MedBay and confirm {TGT_MW.SUBJ} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:still want|Default:still wants} to do this. Darius jumps up and heads off to the barracks as you proceed to the MedBay to speak to the Argo's surgeon. You arrive to find the surgeon inspecting the Neural Implant matrix. They look up when you arrive, "Hello, Commander. [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] is being prepped for surgery as we speak." You nod, "You feel comfortable performing this procedure?" The surgeon nods back, "I do Commander. I have done similar types of surgeries in my past before I hired on with your company." You turn to exit the room, "Very well, let me know how the procedure goes." :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: Hours later, Darius finds you in the lounge, "Boss, umm, well, we lost [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]. You lean forward in your chair, head in hands, staring at the floor, "How? What happened." Darius's shoulders slump, "Apparently [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] had a reaction to the implants. The doc said..." You look up, anger on your face, "What the hell?! I thought they did a full medical workup on [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]?" Darius sits down, "They did. But [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]'s condition was one that in 99% of these types of surgeries is never an issue. This time, it was." You fall back into the chair and down the whiskey in your glass, "Drop off the reports to my office and I will get them signed off and filed and notify [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]'s kin."

You lean forward in your chair, head in hands, staring at the floor, "How? What happened." Darius's shoulders slump, "Apparently [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] had a reaction to the implants. You fall back into the chair and down the whiskey in your glass, "Drop off the reports to my office and I will get them signed off and filed and notify [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]'s kin."

The doc said..." You look up, anger on your face, "What the hell?! I thought they did a full medical workup on [[TRT_MW,{TRT_MW.Callsign}]]?" Darius sits down, "They did. But [[TRT_MW,{TRT_MW.Callsign}]]'s condition was one that in 99% of these types of surgeries is never an issue. This time, it was." You fall back into the chair and down the whiskey in your glass, "Drop off the reports to my office and I will get them signed off and filed and notify [[TRT_MW,{TRT_MW.Callsign}]]'s kin."

content.original:
You look over the names and records of the three volunteers.  You thumb back through their files numerous times, before letting out a long sigh and closed the datapad.

You hand the pad back to Darius, "Thanks Darius, but I do not think any of those three pilots understand the risks involved here.  See if there are any other volunteers.  We do not need to rush into this blindly."

Darius takes the datapad, "As you wish, Boss."

content.original: You read through the information displayed on the datapad and scribble your signature. Handing the pad to Darius as you stand up, "Ok, let's get this show on the road! Darius stands up, "I will inform the rest of the Command Staff," and heads off to the bridge as you proceed to the MedBay to speak to the Argo's surgeon. You arrive to find the surgeon inspecting the scans of your neural map. "Hello, Commander, do you have any questions before we get you prepped?" You nod, "Yes, yes I do. Do you feel comfortable performing this procedure?" The surgeon nods back, "I do Commander. I have done similar types of surgeries in my past before I hired on with your company. As you know, there are possible..." You interupt the surgeon, "I know all the downsides, no need to go over them again." The surgeon motions to a side door, "Well then, let's get you prepped for the procedure." :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: You open you eyes to see Darius' grinning visage smiling down at you. You flinch, thinking you are in some nightmare, then realise you are awakening in Post-Op, "You're awake Commander! Good! How do you feel?" beams Darius. "Ugh, I hurt all over, and my head is pounding too." The surgeon moves into your view, "That is to be expected, Commander. Everything seems to have gone fine with your surgery. You should be up and moving in the next couple of days. You can then begin physical and simpod training and by the end of the month should be well enough to go out into the field. It may take up to a year for you to regain 100% of your coordination back though." You smile, "This will be glorious!"

The extra time healing and training will set us back nearly 4x the initial costs." You smile, and raise your glass, "The cost is irrelevant, I am just glad they pulled through. Keep me posted Darius."

Handing the pad to Darius as you stand up, "Ok, lets get [[TRT_MW,{TRT_MW.Callsign}]] to the MedBay and confirm {TRT_MW.SUBJ} {TRT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:still want|Default:still wants} to do this. You turn to exit the room, "Very well, let me know how the procedure goes." :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: Hours later, Darius finds you in the lounge, "Boss, umm, well, we lost [[TRT_MW,{TRT_MW.Callsign}]]. You lean forward in your chair, head in hands, staring at the floor, "How? What happened." Darius's shoulders slump, "Apparently [[TRT_MW,{TRT_MW.Callsign}]] had a reaction to the implants. The doc said..." You look up, anger on your face, "What the hell?! I thought they did a full medical workup on [[TRT_MW,{TRT_MW.Callsign}]]?" Darius sits down, "They did. But [[TRT_MW,{TRT_MW.Callsign}]]'s condition was one that in 99% of these types of surgeries is never an issue. This time, it was." You fall back into the chair and down the whiskey in your glass, "Drop off the reports to my office and I will get them signed off and filed and notify [[TRT_MW,{TRT_MW.Callsign}]]'s kin."

content.original:
You look over the names and records of the three volunteers.  You thumb back through their files numerous times, before letting out a long sigh and closed the datapad.

You hand the pad back to Darius, "Thanks Darius, but I do not think any of those three pilots understand the risks involved here.  See if there are any other volunteers.  We do not need to rush into this blindly."

Darius takes the datapad, "As you wish, Boss."

content.original: You read through the information displayed on the datapad and scribble your signature. Handing the pad to Darius as you stand up, "Ok, let's get this show on the road! Darius stands up, "I will inform the rest of the Command Staff," and heads off to the bridge as you proceed to the MedBay to speak to the Argo's surgeon. You arrive to find the surgeon inspecting the Neural Implant matrix. "Hello, Commander, do you have any questions before we get you prepped?" You nod, "Yes, yes I do. Do you feel comfortable performing this procedure?" The surgeon nods back, "I do Commander. I have done similar types of surgeries in my past before I hired on with your company. As you know, there are possible..." You interupt the surgeon, "I know all the downsides, no need to go over them again." The surgeon motions to a side door, "Well then, let's get you prepped for the procedure." :::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: You open you eyes to see Darius' grinning visage smiling down at you. You flinch, thinking you are in some nightmare, then realise you are awakening in Post-Op, "You're awake Commander! Good! How do you feel?" beams Darius. "Ugh, I hurt all over, and my head is pounding too." The surgeon moves into your view, "That is to be expected, Commander. Everything seems to have gone fine with your implants. You should be up and moving in the next couple of days. You can then begin physical and simpod training and by the end of the month should be well enough to go out into the field." You smile, "This will be glorious!"

You flinch, thinking you are in some nightmare, then realise you are awakening in Post-Op, "You're awake Commander! Good! How do you feel?" beams Darius. "Ugh, I hurt all over, and my head is pounding too." The surgeon moves into your view, "That is to be expected, Commander. There were serious complications, but we were able to pull you through. You will need extended rehab and simpod training over the next few months before you will be well enough to go out into the field." Darius leans in, "The extra time healing and training will set us back nearly 4x the initial costs." You smile, "The cost is irrelevant, Darius. This will be glorious!"

content.original:
You look over information on the datapad, thumbing back and forth through the file numerous times, before letting out a long sigh and closing the datapad.

You hand the pad back to Darius, "Thanks Darius, but I do not think I will take any unnecessary risks at this time.  I do not need to rush into this blindly."

Darius takes the datapad, "As you wish, Commander."

content.original: You turn from Darius to look at the wreckage of your former opponent's mech,  "That Mechwarrior failed the Trial, and failed to impress me.  I have no need of one such as them within our ranks."

content.original: You look at Darius, "Find out where my opponent is now and bring me a bondscord. We will do this the Clan way." Darius heads off to look for the fallen MechWarrior. Advance a day to get the results

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "Yes, they are in exam room C." The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Seated on the exam table is the MechWarrior you fought with freshly applied bandages covering parts of their body. You look your former opponent in the eyes, "You fought valiantly, and I now claim you as my [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. You will wear this [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] until you have sufficently demonstrated all three virtues: combat talent, integrity and loyalty." As you reach forward to place the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] on the MechWarrior's wrist, they pull their arm behind them, "My honour will not allow me to become a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. I claim my right of refusal." You nod assent, "As you wish, MechWarrior." You feel saddened at the loss of a potentially great pilot as you and Darius exit the building to head back to the Argo

The nurse types in some information into the computer, "Yes, they are in exam room C." The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Seated on the exam table is the MechWarrior you fought with freshly applied bandages covering parts of their body. You look your former opponent in the eyes, "You fought valiantly, and I now claim you as my [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. You will wear this [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] until you have sufficently demonstrated all three virtues: combat talent, integrity and loyalty." As you reach forward to place the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] on the MechWarrior's wrist, they pull their arm behind them, "My honour will not allow me to become a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. I claim my right of refusal." You nod assent, "As you wish, MechWarrior." You feel saddened at the loss of a potentially great pilot as you and Darius exit the building to head back to the Argo

You reach foward and attach the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] to MechWarrior Dante's right wrist, "With this [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]], I claim you as [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]." MechWarrior Dante will meet you in the barracks.

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You turn from Darius to look at the wreckage of your former opponent's mech,  "That Mechwarrior failed the Trial, and failed to impress me.  I have no need of one such as them within our ranks."

content.original: You look at Darius, "Find out where my opponent is now and bring me a bondscord. We will do this the Clan way." Darius heads off to look for the fallen MechWarrior. Advance a day to get the results

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "Yes, they are in exam room C." The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Seated on the exam table is the MechWarrior you fought with freshly applied bandages covering parts of their body. You look your former opponent in the eyes, "You fought valiantly, and I now claim you as my [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. You will wear this [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] until you have sufficently demonstrated all three virtues: combat talent, integrity and loyalty." As you reach forward to place the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] on the MechWarrior's wrist, they pull their arm behind them, "My honour will not allow me to become a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. I claim my right of refusal." You nod assent, "As you wish, MechWarrior." You feel saddened at the loss of a potentially great pilot as you and Darius exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "Yes, they are in exam room C." The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Seated on the exam table is the MechWarrior you fought with freshly applied bandages covering parts of their body. You look your former opponent in the eyes, "You fought valiantly, and I now claim you as my [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. You will wear this [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] until you have sufficently demonstrated all three virtues: combat talent, integrity and loyalty." As you reach forward to place the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] on the MechWarrior's wrist, they pull their arm behind them, "My honour will not allow me to become a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. I claim my right of refusal." You nod assent, "As you wish, MechWarrior." You feel saddened at the loss of a potentially great pilot as you and Darius exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

The nurse types in some information into the computer, "Yes, they are in exam room C." The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Seated on the exam table is the MechWarrior you fought with freshly applied bandages covering parts of their body. You look your former opponent in the eyes, "You fought valiantly, and I now claim you as my [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. You will wear this [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] until you have sufficently demonstrated all three virtues: combat talent, integrity and loyalty." As you reach forward to place the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] on the MechWarrior's wrist, they pull their arm behind them, "My honour will not allow me to become a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. I claim my right of refusal." You nod assent, "As you wish, MechWarrior." You feel saddened at the loss of a potentially great pilot as you and Darius exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You turn from Darius to look at the wreckage of your former opponent's mech,  "That Mechwarrior failed the Trial, and failed to impress me.  I have no need of one such as them within our ranks."

content.original: You look at Darius, "Find out where my opponent is now and bring me a bondscord. We will do this the Clan way." Darius heads off to look for the fallen MechWarrior. Advance a day to get the results

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "Yes, they are in exam room C." The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Seated on the exam table is the MechWarrior you fought with freshly applied bandages covering parts of their body. You look your former opponent in the eyes, "You fought valiantly, and I now claim you as my [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. You will wear this [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] until you have sufficently demonstrated all three virtues: combat talent, integrity and loyalty." As you reach forward to place the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] on the MechWarrior's wrist, they pull their arm behind them, "My honour will not allow me to become a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondsman],bondsman]]. I claim my right of refusal." You nod assent, "As you wish, MechWarrior." You feel saddened at the loss of a potentially great pilot as you and Darius exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

content.original: You and Darius head over to the Infirmary, where you are stopped by a nurse outside the entrance, "May I assist you?," the nurse asks. Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "I regret to inform you, but that pilot succumbed to their injuries," You address the nurse, "Any chance I can pay my respects to the deceased?" The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Behind a windowed wall is the body of your opponent, covered by a sheet. You stare through the window at the body of your former opponent, "We mourn your passing, MechWarrior. You fought bravely." You and Darius then exit the building to head back to the Argo

Darius steps forward, "My Commander was one of the combatants in that duel, and wished to speak with the opponent he faced." The nurse types in some information into the computer, "Yes, they are in exam room C." The nurse points at the palm scanner, "Place your hand there to sign in, then go through the doors to the 3rd room on the left." You follow the directions given and arrive with Darius at the room. Seated on the exam table is the MechWarrior you fought with freshly applied bandages covering parts of their body. You look your former opponent in the eyes, "You fought valiantly Star Captain Pheona O'Reilly, and I now claim you as my [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondswoman],bondswoman]]. You will wear this [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] until you have sufficently demonstrated all three virtues: combat talent, integrity and loyalty." You reach foward and attach the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]] to Star Captain Pheona O'Reilly's right wrist, "With this [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondcord],bondcord]], I claim you as [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBondswoman],bondswoman]]." content.original:
"MechWarriors belong in the 'Mechs. Technicians belong in the Mech Bay. Let the specialists do their jobs."

As [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] starts to get up, you gesture at the pile of bits on the ground. "And clean up this mess. I don't want the Chief stumbling across your experiment in the morning."

content.original:
"I suppose that was in storage for a reason, so maybe it won't hurt to see if your idea works. Just be careful. It may only be a 20 ton 'Mech, but it is not worthless."

Later that week, [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] catches you in the hall, glowing with excitement.

"I did it, Commander! That locust is a LOT deadlier now. Well, in the hands of a mech that wants to clobber other 'Mechs. I welded the legs together, removed the weapons and other gear and then filled all the empty spaces with scrap metal to bring it back to 20 tons.  I call it the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[BaseDesc_Special_Mace_Locust],Locust Stick]]."

I welded the legs together, removed the weapons and other gear and then filled all the empty spaces with scrap metal to bring it back to 20 tons.  I call it the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[BaseDesc_Special_Mace_Locust],Locust Stick]]."

"I suppose that was in storage for a reason, so maybe it won't hurt to see if your idea works. Just be careful. It may only be a 20 ton 'Mech, but it is not worthless."
