content.original:
"MechWarriors belong in the 'Mechs. Technicians belong in the Mech Bay. But you seem pretty knowledgeable about these things, and you've already pulled the schematics have the 'Mech in a harness. Explain to Yang what you were going for, and maybe he can finish what you started."

Later that week, you catch [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] in the hall.

"Chief Virtanen wanted me to pass along the good news. He investigated your suggestions and managed to turn that Locust into a 20 ton mace.  He's called it the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[BaseDesc_Special_Mace_Locust],Locust Stick]]."

{TGT_MW.Callsign} basks in the glow of victory. "I knew it would work! So does that mean I'm riding out on the next contract? I feel like I should be the first to get to use it!"

content.original: Darius dips his head in agreement. "You got it, {COMMANDER.FirstName}. I'll make the arrangements." Yang gives you a sidelong glance as your XO turns to go. "And I'll go prepare our salvage team. If this goes the way I hope it will, we stand to gain some pretty impressive hardware. Exotic weapons, strange new 'Mechs. Things I haven't even imagined yet." "And knowledge, Yang," Farah adds, her eyes glittering with excitement. "Knowledge and adventure, with the promise of more to come."

content.original: You nod at Farah. "Your lead sounds promising. Follow up on it. For the time being, this is your top priority." Later, Farah calls you into Engineering. You find her standing in front of a terminal, a huge smile on her face. "I did what you askedyou know, dug for informationand I've found it! The patients, all of whom had substantial criminal histories, shared a common point of origin: [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAppian],Appian]]. I've already told Sumire, and she's marked it on our star map." You nod. "Good work, Farah. Our hunt for the Dobrev is back on, thanks to you."

content.original: You nod at Sumire. "Okay, Meyer, your lead sounds promising. Follow up on it. For the time being, this is your top priority." Later, she calls you to the bridge. You find her standing by the viewscreen, a weary half smile on her face. "Found it. Long story, I'd rather not get into itwhiskey and cigars were involved. But the Dobrev is on [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAppian],Appian]]. I've marked it on the star map already. We can get going whenever you want. " You nod. "Good work, Sumire. Our hunt for the Dobrev is back on, thanks to you." She rolls her eyes. "Don't remind me."

content.original: You let your voice take on a hard edge. "I'm not afraid of Natasha Kerensky. {COMPANY.CompanyName} beat the Black Widow Company back on [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAppian],Appian]]. And if it comes to a fight, I will gladly do it again." Darius crosses his arms over his chest. "The Commander is right. We can beat the Black Widow. All we need to do is be prepared." Sumire's lips tighten, but she says nothing. Eventually, she sighs. "I'll mark Mantharaka on the star map, but we'd better not go before we're ready. When I land us there, we're gonna be committed to seeing this job through to the end."

content.original:
You nod at Farah. "Dr. Murad is right. Like Darius said, the Black Widow is going planet to planet, destroying every black market operation the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBaumannGroup],Baumann Group]] has touched. If we move quickly enough, we can get in and out before she even shows up."

Darius nods slowly. "Sure, that could work. But once we've committed to landing on Mantharaka, we'll be stuck there until the job is done. We'd better be prepared to fight her, just in case."

content.original:
When you arrive with Darius at the local MRB offices, [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreRepKurita], Shugo Yamaguchi]] is already there. He nods stiffly in your direction.

The Review Board agent walks everyone through the contract, including video footage and witness testimonies. Darius bites his tongue when the agent reads a statement from [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreGakuHironaka],Chu-i Hironaka]] refuting claims regarding the quality of the intelligence provided. Yamaguchi follows your lead and keeps quiet throughout.

Back in the reception area again while the MRB deliberates, the Shugo leans close enough that only the two of you can hear. "You were in the right here. Hironaka has been disciplined appropriately. Win or lose, you have acted the professional."

When the MRB agent appears and rules in your favor on all counts, Yamaguchi bows deeply and departs without another word.

content.original:
When you arrive with Darius at the local MRB offices, [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreRepKurita], Shugo Yamaguchi]] is already there. He nods stiffly in your direction.

The Review Board agent walks everyone through the contract, including video footage and witness testimonies. When Darius hears the statement from [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreGakuHironaka],Chu-i Hironaka]] refuting claims regarding the quality of the intelligence provided, the discussion gets heated. Yamaguchi comes to the defense of his 'Mech Commander, and soon the MRB agent is forced to clear the room.

Finally, the MRB agent appears and delivers the ruling in your favor on all counts, with additional compensation for 'damages' to the Company's reputation. Yamaguchi turns on his heels and departs without another word.

When Darius hears the statement from [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreGakuHironaka],Chu-i Hironaka]] refuting claims regarding the quality of the intelligence provided, the discussion gets heated. Yamaguchi comes to the defense of his 'Mech Commander, and soon the MRB agent is forced to clear the room.

Finally, the MRB agent appears and delivers the ruling in your favor on all counts, with additional compensation for 'damages' to the Company's reputation. Yamaguchi turns on his heels and departs without another word.

content.original:
When you arrive with Darius at the local MRB offices, [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreRepKurita], Shugo Yamaguchi]] is already there. He nods stiffly in your direction.

The Review Board agent begins to walk everyone through the contract, including video footage and witness testimonies. Before any debate can begin, however, you interrupt. "Upon further review of the evidence, we wish to withdraw our complaint. Our apologies to the honorable representative of the Draconis Combine for any inconvenience we have caused." 

In the shocked silence that follows, you can hear the sound of Darius's teeth grinding together.

Back in the reception area, while the MRB finalizes the paperwork, the Shugo leans close enough that only the two of you can hear. "You are full of surprises, Commander. Keep an eye on your bank account for a small thank-you." Yamaguchi bows deeply and departs without another word.

content.original:
Turning to Darius, who is already deep in thought, you say, "What do you think? Perhaps your contacts in the Black Market could dig up the dirt we would need?"

The XO scowls but agrees. "Hell certainly back off before he brings shame to his family or to the House. I'll get on it right away."

Later in the week, you receive a recorded message from [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreRepKurita], Shugo Yamaguchi]] "Commander, I am contacting you regarding our little dispute, and how you have seen fit to involve the MRB. I have decided to concede all points in your favor."

With a thin-lipped look that seems a cross between anger and respect, he continues. "I did not expect such cunning from a mere Mercenary. We will, of course, never speak of this again."

content.original:
The confused preacher makes a half-hearted argument about your identity before giving up and moving down the street with his pamphlets.

At the edge of the market, the Liao soldiers glance in your direction, then go about their business.

Darius says, "Commander, we may have made the right decision about the Volkovites. That doesn't mean we need to bring it to Lady Liao's attention yet again."

content.original: Upon admitting your role in the escape of the Volkovites, the locals in the market soon surround you with thank-yous and questions about "the great escape". Darius and [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] soon have their hands full of gifts of fresh fruits and vegetables, as well as folksy arts and crafts. At the edge of the market, it's hard to miss a Liao soldier talking on a communicator, glancing in your direction. No doubt Lady Marina Liao will hear of this, and find it a twist of the dagger of your earlier betrayal. Darius says, "Commander, we made the right call. I think the crew back on the Argo will be encouraged," he gestures broadly at the crowd, "to hear that we've made a difference."

content.original: [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] approaches the young soldiers, and has soon captivated them with heroic Mech stories from a fellow Capellan. Turning to the preacher, you admit your role in the escape of the Volkovites. The locals in the market surround you with thank-yous and questions about "the great escape". They also ply you and Darius with gifts of fresh fruits and vegetables, as well as folksy arts and crafts. It's all a bit overwhelming. Darius says, "Commander, we made the right call. I think the crew back on the Argo will be encouraged," he gestures broadly at the crowd, "to hear that we've made a difference."

content.original:
You approach the young soldiers and have soon captivated them with heroic Mech stories from a fellow Capellan.

Meanwhile, Darius admits the company's role in the escape of the Volkovites. The locals in the market surround him with thank-yous and questions about "the great escape".

They also ply Darius and [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] with gifts of fresh fruits and vegetables, as well as folksy arts and crafts. It's all a bit overwhelming.

When you regroup at the transport, Darius says, "Commander, we made the right call. I think the crew back on the Argo will be encouraged," he gestures broadly at the departing crowd, "to hear that we've made a difference."

content.original:
The confused preacher makes a half-hearted argument about your identity before giving up and moving down the street with his pamphlets.

The rest of the crowd hums for a moment longer, disappointed at the lack of conflict, but then continues with their business in the market.

Darius breathes a sigh of relief. "Commander, we may or may not have made the right decisions about the Volkovites. But they're Lady Liao's problem now, not ours. Best to stay out of this as best we can."

content.original: The preacher seems confused and puts up a raucous insistence as to your identity. Then one of his followers shouts "Murderers!" and levels her rifle. [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] leaps in the way as a shot rings out, and {TGT_MW.SUBJ} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:spin|Default:spins} to the ground, clutching {TGT_MW.DET} arm. After that, all hell breaks loose. By the time the authorities arrive on the scene, you and your team are long gone, nursing your injuries on the shuttle ride back to the Argo. Darius breathes a sigh of frustration. "Commander, these Volkovites are Lady Liao's problem now, not ours. If we must pick a fight with them, perhaps we should be in our 'Mechs."

content.original:
You stall for time with the preacher, keeping him confused, yet engaged. Meanwhile, [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] maneuvers through the crowd. One after the other, {TGT_MW.SUBJ} quietly disarms several thugs. The crowd is none the wiser, focused as they are on the preacher's insistence as to your identity.

The rest of the crowd hums for a moment longer, disappointed at the lack of conflict, but then continues with their business in the market.

content.original: The preacher seems confused and puts up a raucous insistence as to your identity. Then one of his followers shouts "Murderers!" and levels her rifle. [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] leaps in the way as a shot rings out, and {TGT_MW.SUBJ} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:spin|Default:spins} to the ground, clutching {TGT_MW.DET} arm. After that, all hell breaks loose. By the time the authorities arrive on the scene, you and your team are long gone, nursing your injuries on the shuttle ride back to the Argo. Darius breathes a sigh of frustration. "Commander, these Volkovites are Lady Liao's problem now, not ours. If we must pick a fight with them, perhaps we should be in our 'Mechs."

content.original:
Leaning back in your chair, you look up at the drunks nonchalantly. "Yeah, that was us. We even gave the murdering blowhard the one-on-one matchup he was asking for."

One of the fans chuffs loudly. "Yeah, I was expecting you to drop a full lance of 'Mechs on his head."

Her friend chimes in. "I'm glad you went with the straight up fight. It was the only way to win honorably. Can I buy you and your crew the next round?"

[[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] accepts the offer eagerly, and regales the fans with a detailed retelling of the battle.

content.original:
Leaning back in your chair, you look up at the drunks nonchalantly. "Yeah, that was us. We even gave the murdering blowhard the one-on-one matchup he was asking for."

One of the fans groans loudly. "You should've dropped a full lance of 'Mechs on his head, after what he did to Arjun."

Her friend chimes in. "He didn't deserve a fighting chance, or an honorable death."

[[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] tenses in {TGT_MW.DET} chair, anticipating a brawl. The unruly fans aren't so drunk or stupid as to to fight hardened MechWarriors, though, and they grumble their way to the bar for another round.

content.original: Leaning back in your chair, you look up at the drunks nonchalantly. "Yeah, that was us. We even gave the murdering blowhard the one-on-one matchup he was asking for." One of the fans starts shouting. "What do you even know? You killed The Beast just because he gave Arjun what he deserved?!?" Her friend steps forward, fist clenched. "The Steiners had been bad-mouthing The Beast for weeks. He couldn't let Arjun live after that!" [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] tenses in {TGT_MW.DET} chair, and when the third drunken fan steps too close, fists begin to fly. Later that afternoon, on the shuttle back to the Argo, {TGT_MW.Callsign} nurses {TGT_MW.Det} wounds. "We should do that again sometime, Commander!"

content.original:
Leaning back in your chair, you look up at the drunks nonchalantly. "No, you've got the wrong guys. We saw the same match you did on the Ironwood channel. Holovid quality so high, it was like you were there."

One of the fans chuffs loudly. "Yeah, I was half expecting those mercenaries to drop a full lance of 'Mechs on his head."

Her friend chimes in. "I'm glad they went with the straight up fight. The only way to win honorably. Can I buy you and your crew the next round?"

[[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] accepts the offer eagerly, and they spend the afternoon discussing numerous recent Solaris VII matches.

content.original:
Leaning back in your chair, you look up at the drunks nonchalantly. "Yeah, that was us. That murdering blowhard even showed up with a full lance, despite his request for a one-on-one duel."

One of the fans groans loudly. "You should've called his bluff and killed him with a single 'Mech anyway. Ultimate humiliation."

Her friend argues, "He only brought full strength because he knew mercenary scum wouldn't have been brave enough to fight one-on-one!"

[[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] tenses in {TGT_MW.DET} chair, anticipating a brawl. But the unruly fans aren't so drunk or stupid as to to fight hardened MechWarriors, and they grumble their way to the bar for another round.

content.original:
"Ms. Hadley, after what you pulled the last time, youre at the top of my list of people not to trust. Given my line of work, I hope you appreciate that."

The thief manages to pout and smile at the same time. "Oh, Commander, that's just because you don't know me yet. I'm very good to my friends."

Waving her hands to concede defeat, "Very well. Perhaps next time." At that, the signal cuts off before you can say another word.

Darius pops in, having clearly been listening to the call. "I'm not sure if I hate her or love her."

content.original: [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] waves goodbye as {TGT_MW.SUBJ} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:climb|Default:climbs} aboard the shuttle. Darius arches an eyebrow at you, clearly as curious as you are as to how this will turn out. Later that week, you receive a coded message from Ms. Hadley. "Commander, thanks for loaning me your MechWarrior. {TGT_MW.Gender?Male:He's|Female:She's|NonBinary:They're} a natural. I've already arranged shipment of the fruits of our labor." She shrugs innocently. "But I'm going to hang onto {TGT_MW.Callsign} a few weeks longer. I have some new leads I need to follow. And it's a two person job."

content.original: Lady Alexandria Cunningham thanks you profusely as her agents slap Ayasha Hadley into restraints and march her aboard the nearby transport. It's not until you arrive back on the Argo that Darius asks, "Commander, did you see [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] get on board?" The sinking feeling in your stomach is echoed in Darius' face. Later that week, you receive a coded message from Ms. Hadley. "I'm disappointed that you didn't want to play along, Commander. But it did speed my plans quite a bit, because of where Lady Cunningham decided to keep me prisoner. A temporary arrangement, of course." "Don't worry about your MechWarrior. I'll deliver {TGT_MW.OBJ} safe and sound, just like I promised, just as soon as I'm done with {TGT_MW.OBJ}."

content.original: "{TGT_MW.FirstName}... stop." Such familiarity from {TGT_MW.DET} commanding officer brings {TGT_MW.OBJ} up short. {TGT_MW.SUBJ_C} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:turn|Default:turns} around, fists still clenched from the argument with [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]. "You need to calm down, pilot. {SCN_MW.Callsign} couldnt know how personal the battle with Gwydion company was for you. Keep in mind, when {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:complain|Default:complains} about unnecessary risks, {SCN_MW.SUBJ}'{SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:re|Default:s} thinking about your safety and the safety of the rest of the company." The MechWarrior reluctantly concedes your point. "Sometimes... I don't know, just, this mercenary life feels so empty. Once in a while, we do something for more than just money and then I know that risking my life out there is worth it. Thanks, Commander. I'll be okay now."

content.original: "{SCN_MW.FirstName}... come with me." Such familiarity from {SCN_MW.DET} commanding officer brings {SCN_MW.OBJ} up short. {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:follow|Default:follows} you into the hall. "You clearly didnt know that {TGT_MW.Callsign} took the battle with Gwydion company so personally. But you need to keep in mind just how small the Periphery can be. Every Noble House is represented on the Argo, and no small number of individual systems." {SCN_MW.Callsign} looks at {SCN_MW.DET} feet. "Yeah, I didn't think it through. But I guess every contract we take might be attacking someone's cousin. Well, shit, I'll go talk to {TGT_MW.Callsign} and apologize."

content.original: "{SCN_MW.FirstName}... come with me." Such familiarity from {SCN_MW.DET} commanding officer brings {SCN_MW.OBJ} up short. {SCN_MW.SUBJ_C} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:follow|Default:follows} you into the hall. "You clearly didnt know that {TGT_MW.Callsign} took the battle with Gwydion company so personally. But you need to keep in mind just how small the Periphery can be. Every Noble House is represented on the Argo, and no small number of individual systems." {SCN_MW.Callsign} defiantly looks you in the eye. "Commander, I get it, I really do. But when I joined this company, I left all that behind. Every contract we take might be attacking someone's cousin. If I let that into my head, I'd be afraid of pulling the trigger out on the battlefield. Do you want me to follow orders, or not?" Not waiting for an answer, {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:turn|Default:turns} on {SCN_MW.DET} heel and strides away.

content.original: When the MechWarriors arrive at your quarters and see the look on your face, they both look nervous. "I don't care if you disagree with my orders, as long as you follow them. We're in a dangerous business. On the battlefield, you will have each other's back, is that clear?" "Sir, yes sir!" they shout in unison, eyes fixed on a spot on the wall past your shoulder. You look both of them in the eyes. "And you will keep your mouths shut about any misgivings in front of your fellow MechWarriors. If you undermine my authority one more time, I'll ship you planetside." You pause for effect. "Or better yet, I'll put you in a Spider on the next contract."

content.original: "{TGT_MW.FirstName}... stop." Such familiarity from {TGT_MW.DET} commanding officer brings {TGT_MW.OBJ} up short. {TGT_MW.SUBJ} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:turn|Default:turns} around, fists still clenched from the argument with [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]. "You need to calm down, pilot. {SCN_MW.Callsign} didn't know how personally the battle with Gwydion company affected you. Keep in mind, when {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:complain|Default:complains} about unnecessary risks, {SCN_MW.SUBJ}'{SCN_MW.Gender?NonBinary:re|Default:s} thinking about your safety and the safety of the rest of the company." The MechWarrior shakes {TGT_MW.DET} head. "Sometimes... I don't know, just, this mercenary life feels so empty. Just once we need to do something for more than just money. I want to know that risking my life out there is worth it." Not waiting for an answer, {TGT_MW.SUBJ_C} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:turn|Default:turns} on {TGT_MW.DET} heel and strides away.

content.original: "{SCN_MW.FirstName}... come with me." Such familiarity from {SCN_MW.DET} commanding officer brings {SCN_MW.OBJ} up short. {SCN_MW.SUBJ} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:follow|Default:follows} you into the hall. "You clearly didnt know that {TGT_MW.Callsign} took the battle with Gwydion company so personally. But you need to keep in mind just how small the Periphery can be. Every Noble House is represented on the Argo, and no small number of individual systems." {SCN_MW.Callsign} looks at {SCN_MW.DET} feet. "Yeah, I didn't think it through. But I guess every contract we take might be attacking someone's cousin. Well shit, I'll go talk to {TGT_MW.Callsign} and apologize."

content.original: "{SCN_MW.FirstName}... come with me." content.original:
You stare daggers at [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]. "You breathe a word about this, and you'll be riding a Spider until the day you die. Which is likely on the first deployment."

{TGT_MW.Callsign} gulps audibly, but Darius can barely contain his mirth. Your XO pats you on the shoulder. "Come on, Commander, all PR is good PR. Maybe we can work this to our advantage."

Seeing the look on your face, he amends his statement. "Or not..."

The waitress, who was about to ask if you'd like another round, does a deft pirouette and continues her tour amongst the other tables.

But when you enter, everyone is eating in conspicuous silence.

content.original: Seeing your nod of concession, [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] pulls out a recorder and begins capturing the performance. There's even an encore, so {TGT_MW.SUBJ} {TGT_MW.Gender?NonBinary:get|Default:gets} the whole thing from the beginning. Back on the Argo, the video from the bar circulates quickly among the MechWarriors and crew. It's not surprising that there were disagreements with your decision at the time to help the embattled locals. But knowing that the company's actions have become folk song legend? Attitudes have completely turned around. The technicians in the MechBay, in particular, have taken to singing The Hero of the Valley almost non-stop. Yang complains about it half-heartedly, but productivity is certainly higher!

content.original:
As the chords of the final verse fade away, and the applause dies down, you stand on your chair and raise your glass. "A toast!" The room responds with gusto.

"It's a delightful song to be sure, but I don't know that you truly captured the drama of the escape in the third verse. You see... I was there."

A patron close to your table, with a good look at the insignia on [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]]'s jacket, stands and points at you. "It's {COMMANDER.Callsign}! It's really {COMMANDER.OBJ}!"

The rest of the afternoon involves the telling and retelling of the story, and many offers to buy the next round of drinks. By the time you pour yourselves into the shuttle bound for space, {TGT_MW.Callsign} is positively glowing from the adoration from the crowd. "Commander, we really made a difference. We gave hope to these people."

content.original: Leaning back in your chair, you look up at the drunks nonchalantly, 'The Pirate Queen herself was begging for our help, no one else could even come close to our abilities. We sent that AI packing!' One of the fans chuffs loudly, 'Why would the Pirate Queen need a nobody Merc like you?' A friend chimes in: 'That's not how I heard the story at all!' [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] *Laughs*... Yeah, wait until you hear what really happened.'

content.original: Leaning back in your chair, you look up at the drunks nonchalantly, 'We were actually just hanging out and saw the Pirate Queen's jumpship in trouble, and they had to hire us just to get out of system. I tell you, they were begging for our help.' One of the fans groans loudly, 'You should have told those pirates where to stick it.' Her friend chimes in, 'If you ask me, Pirates didn't deserve the help.' [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] tenses in {TGT_MW.DET} chair and bellows out, 'Thats not even what happened! The Commander needs a reminder of the real events.'

content.original: Leaning back in your chair, you look up at the drunks nonchalantly, 'We not only saved the Inner Sphere but the Pirate Queen personally praised us and offered us jobs as one of her minions.' One of the fans starts shouting, 'You are just as bad as them then?!?' Her friend steps forward, fists clenched, 'You know Pirates killed my brother!' [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] tenses in {TGT_MW.DET} chair and when the third drunkard steps too close, fists begin to fly. Later that afternoon, on the shuttle back to the Argo, {TGT_MW.Callsign} nurses {TGT_MW.Det} wounds. 'You really should have told them what really happened Commander.'

content.original: Leaning back in your chair, you look up at the drunks nonchalantly,'No, you've got the wrong guys. We were working for ComStar the last few months.' One of the drunks chuffs loudly, 'So you were not on Antallos two months ago?' Her friend chimes in, 'I'm glad they went around helping the locals, I know I saw them out there.' [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] whispers, 'You really should tell them the truth.'

content.original: Leaning back in your chair, you look up at the drunks nonchalantly, 'We were actually just hanging out and saw ComStar's jumpship in trouble, they had to hire us just to get out of system. I tell you They were begging for our help.' One of the fans groans loudly, 'You should have told ComStar where to stick it.' Her friend chimes in, 'If you ask me ComStar didn't deserve the help.' [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] tenses in {TGT_MW.DET} chair and bellows out, 'Thats not even what happened! The Commander needs a reminder of the real events.'

content.original: Leaning back in your chair, you look up at the drunks nonchalantly, 'We not only saved the Inner Sphere but ComStar personally praised us and offered us jobs.' One of the fans starts shouting, 'You are just as bad as them then?!?' Her friend steps forward, fist clenched, 'You know ComStar killed my brother!' [[TGT_MW,{TGT_MW.Callsign}]] tenses in {TGT_MW.DET} chair and when the third drunkard steps too close, fists begin to fly. Later that afternoon, on the shuttle back to the Argo, {TGT_MW.Callsign} nurses {TGT_MW.Det} wounds. 'You really should have told them what really happened Commander.'

content.original: "Everyone saddle up; looks like we're going bounty hunting! By the way, [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]]...what are they even doing here?", [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[TooltipSimGameCharacterDARIUS],Darius]] asks. "Their latest scheme seems to involve some kind of Salinization Facility on the planet surface. It seems they're trying to convert the entire planet into salt so they can sell it an organization known only as "R.T"... Rogue Traders maybe? It's an ambitious scheme, but I guess they got so caught up in whether they could, they never bothered to ask if they should." [[SCN_MW,{SCN_MW.Callsign}]] replies." A unique contract named Clever Girl has been added to the Command Center.
